flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: I wanted a way to gently remind the family when it was time to clean the catbox. We can usually go a day or two but things get out of hand beyond that. The project is basically a timer that starts counting after each reset which corresponds to the last cleaning and displays the elapsed time on the LCD. After 24 hours it triggers the sound machine to say "Uh Oh!" once an hour and start an LED flashing. After 48 hours it triggers a falling missle sound effect every half hour. After 72 hours it triggers a police car siren sound every 15 minutes.

I wanted a way to gently remind the family when it was time to clean the catbox. We can usually go a day or two but things get out of hand beyond that. The project is basically a timer that starts counting after each reset which corresponds to the last cleaning and displays the elapsed time on the LCD. After 24 hours it triggers the sound machine to say "Uh Oh!" once an hour and start an LED flashing. After 48 hours it triggers a falling missle sound effect every half hour. After 72 hours it triggers a police car siren sound every 15 minutes.

Relevant parts
  • Sainsmart LCD display
  • Arduino Uno
  • Enclosure
  • sound machine
  • audio amplifier
Tools
  • Soldering Iron, Wire strippers, solder, drill, glue

lines.text: Modify the sound machine to permit triggering via the Arduino's digital outputs.
lines.text_raw: Modify the sound machine to permit triggering via the Arduino's digital outputs.

lines.text: To do this, solder a 2n2222 or similar NPN switching transistor across the leads on the sound machine which are actuated when the button on the keypad is pressed.  The base of the transistor will be connected to the Arduino digital output pin via a 1K resistor.

guide.summary: Combine an Arduino, an LCD display, a sound machine and a few components to remind you when its time to clean the cat box.
